actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend the provisions of title 18 and 28 that are commonly called the Rules Enabling Acts to provide a uniform method for the proposal and adoption of certain rules of court by the Judicial Conference, and for other purposes.
short_title: Rules Enabling Act Amendments Act of 1979

summary.text: Rules Enabling Act Amendments Act of 1979 - Amends the Rules Enabling Act to empower the Judicial Conference of the United States, rather than the Supreme Court, to prescribe, contingent upon Congressional approval, rules of pleading, practice, and procedure for Federal courts.

titles.title: Rules Enabling Act Amendments Act of 1979

A bill to amend the provisions of title 18 and 28 that are commonly called the Rules Enabling Acts to provide a uniform method for the proposal and adoption of certain rules of court by the Judicial Conference, and for other purposes.
